notes: Computing Services is located in Cyert Hall, Room A-75.  The Carnegie Mellon Computer Recycling Center (CRC) is a group of volunteers within the Computing Services division at Carnegie Mellon who provide a way for members of the Carnegie Mellon community -- faculty, staff and students -- to dispose of unwanted computer equipment in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. The CRC provides a contact point for university departments and individuals who have computer equipment they no longer need and have questions about how to best dispose of it.

name: Pittsburgh Center for Creative Reuse
materials: Books (Reuse); CD/DVD/Blu-ray/UHD discs; Gift Bags; Greeting Cards; Office Supplies; VHS & Cassette Tapes; Textiles; Cork; Arts & Crafts Supplies (Reuse); Wire; Jewelry; Projectors; Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Computer Peripherals; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: The Pittsburgh Center for Creative Reuse accepts donations of materials from all types of businesses, organizations, and individuals in the greater Pittsburgh area. We take clean, safe materials that might ordinarily be discarded, for which other good reuse outlets do not exist, and that lend themselves to being reused in creative ways. Donations accepted by appointment only!

notes: All donations must be in suitable condition for reuse. Carpet, vinyl flooring, wallpaper, and packaged tile are only accepted new. Visit website for full list and guidelines.. Old appliances, scrap metal, lightbulbs and ballasts, and alkaline batteries are accepted for recycling, fees may apply to some items.

name: Wheels For Wishes

notes: Cars, trucks, SUVs, RVs, motorcycles and boats are accepted. Wheels for Wishes will pick-up or tow away all vehicles, at no charge, whether the vehicles are running or not. Services are completely free of charge.

notes: Free, postage-paid Mail Back envelopes can be found on display in the lobby. There is no limit to the number of envelopes customers may take. The contents of the envelope must weigh less than 13 ounces and the envelope must be able to seal completely. For more details visitMaxBack."
